SEARCH
Package ActorContext

Class ActorContext

java.lang.Object
ActorContext.ActorContext
public class ActorContext extends Object
The ActorContext class is responsible for managing the lifecycle of actors, including spawning and looking up actors. This class is a singleton, meaning that only one instance of it can exist at a time. This is done by having a private constructor and a static getInstance method.

    • spawnActor

      public static ActorProxy spawnActor(Actor actor)
      Spawns a new actor and adds it to the HashMap of actors.
      Parameters:
      actor - the actor object to be spawned.
      Returns:
      an ActorProxy object that can be used to send messages to the actor

    • lookup

      public Actor lookup(String name)
      Looks up an actor by name in the actorsHash map.
      Parameters:
      name - The name of the actor to be looked up.
      Returns:
      The actor with the specified name, or null if no such

    • lookup2

      public Runner lookup2(String name)
      Looks up the Runner by name in the actorsHash map.
      Parameters:
      name - The name of the actor to be looked up.
      Returns:
      The Runner with the specified name, or null if no such Runner exists.
